definition[0]: to search very carefully and thoroughly through an area, a document etc
example[0]: Her family began to scour the countryside for a suitable house.
definition[1]: to clean something very thoroughly by rubbing it with a rough material
example[1]: Ada was scouring out the pans.
definition[2]: to form a hole by continuous movement over a long period
example[2]: Over the years, the stream had scoured out a round pool in the rock.
